title: Aaaand another item getting destroyed because of Ezreal.
body:
{{item:3025}} damage being cut by 20%.

A better nerf would have been lowering the CDR back down to 10%. Riot's overstepping this nerf big time. 

Sheen procs are already sub-par on alot of champs, including ones that utilize them well (Triforce where?). At this rate its going to used as often as Trinity Force, and they'll use that as an excuse to say Trinity Force is in an alright spot.

How about we gut Ezreal's Q for once instead of every item he utilizes well?

Like, I get that everyone is utilizing IBG, but why wouldn't they when its a heavy-handed AD meta where you have to pretty much play AD or a tank to thrive. Tanks need damage to pressure ADCs, so its pretty obvious why its being purchased.

However, Ez single-handedly gets so many items gutted that its pretty obvious what the answer should be by now...

If the excuse really is top-laners rushing sunfire and IBG every game...

How about you buff all of the other armor items you essentially destroyed so they're viable buys again? Either that or nerf the base AD of the champions that are problematic with IBG instead.

People are buying Sunfire and IBG because they're the only armor items that haven't been nerfed over and over until they're practically unusable in this arms race meta. 

IBG will continue to be bought until you nerf it to the point of being as useless as {{item:3078}} for the majority of champions. Its because of this over-loaded AD meta, along with every other armor item being in a horrible state that they're the go-to purchases.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jtr5XE3h,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-06T13:26:25.105+0000)

For the same reason "ADCs being too hard to kill" isn't getting Mercurial and Maw's survivability stats nerfed and Sterak's isn't getting a 'melee only' tag or a health threshold.

You can't tell me you don't notice how quickly 'tanks' and 'bruisers' get melted this season. If they can't pressure in the time they're still alive, they'll stop being useful.

If tank damage goes down, ADC survivability needs to go down so more than just tanks or AD assassins are viable against them.
So who else is abusing IBG other than tanks and Ezreal?

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jtr5XE3h,comment-id=0003000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-06T13:30:52.897+0000)
>
> So who else is abusing IBG other than tanks and Ezreal?

Its not about champions 'abusing' it. I'd hardly say champions are 'abusing' ADC items, despite many of the rush items there being just as binary as IBG. *cough* {{item:3508}} *cough*

The reason is because of the massively lopsided AD meta, not because its OP.

If mages were more viable, IBG would cease to be a rush item unless its absolutely core on that champion. 

Even with the nerfs, people will still use IBG because it offers CDR, damage, and armor. Everything a tank needs for this meta outside of HP, which they will be buying plenty of. 

This isn't solving the issue, which is AD being too strong atm which creates damage spreads leaning way too far towards physical damage. 

In fact, a better 'nerf' would be to make the spellblade procs all magic damage. It would be a self-correcting problem in that every top laner would then also need significant MR in order to lane safely. ADCs would also effectively take less damage due to Maw/Scimitar.

Cinderhulk is in a pretty terrible state, and is a waste on skarner. Why use that item slot for ~600 HP late game when you can use it for something useful? You grab warrior's and black cleaver, you have damage to kill anyone if they're in range for 3 seconds. Buy armor+hp in every other item slot (dead man's, randuins, sunfire), and you'll roll over most team comps.

If they have significant magic damage, use a runepage without 10% CDR and roll spirit visage or locket.
